page.title: 03THE M.11 MEETS MILL STREET
page.content: S.W.corner :{480080}The road linking villages to the east of this square with the New Town of Harlow bridges the M11 which cuts the square N.S. The 500 year old Hogg's Farm:{482089}: has adapted to the times by providing grazing & kennels for privately owned horses & dogs. The 300 year-old {HORN {& HORSESHOES }enjoys a fine-weather trade via the M11 plus the locals. Adjacent to Mill Street & Foster Street lie a mixture of small holdings farms & private houses. The windmill no longer exists , but traces remain at Mill House Farm :{483084}.Mr. Stock, the owner of Morning Sun Cottage is a skillful restorer of horse-drawn carriages; very popular for local weddings. Mr. Stock also keeps goats, ducks,chickens, horses & dogs.
